image.altText: A composite image of Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold dressed in police uniforms.

props.synopsis: The families of Constables Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold tell an inquest into their deaths they are "forever broken".

title.children: Family of slain police officer say her final message was withheld from them for months

image.altText: A group of people walk along a footpath wearing colourful fishing shirts.

props.synopsis: A man accused of the 2022 triple shooting murder of his three neighbours and the attempted murder of another man at Bogie, west of Bowen, has been committed to stand trial in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Grazier to stand trial for alleged triple shooting murder of his neighbours

image.altText: A man in a cardigan stands in front of a stage.

props.synopsis: Oxenford State School principal Patric Brady is not allowed to use the internet while on bail for child-grooming offences.

title.children: Gold Coast primary school principal granted bail over child grooming offences

image.altText: A small white two seater aircraft is on its roof with wrecked wings around it

props.synopsis: Two Sunshine Coast men were treated at the scene before being taken to hospital after their aircraft came down in a rural area at Coondoo just before 11.30am.

title.children: Pair freed from wreckage after light plane crashes east of Gympie

props.synopsis: Kidnapped from his Burkina Faso home at gunpoint in 2016, Ken Elliott survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda.

title.children: As a doctor, he never saw a case of scurvy. As a prisoner of Al Qaeda, that changed

image.altText: Robert Ovadia wearing a suit with a tie

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the Seven network says 13 more women had come forward with complaints in relation to former employee Robert Ovadia.

title.children: Thirteen more women make complaints against former Seven journalist Robert Ovadia, court told

image.altText: A man looks up wearing a black hat, glasses and a blue long sleeve shirt.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old baby was with his family at Hanlon Park around midday on Tuesday, when it's alleged an unknown man approached them and poured hot liquid on the baby.

title.children: Police release new photos in search for man after hot coffee poured on baby at Brisbane park

image.altText: A silhouette shows graduate students wearing gowns and hats.

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's most prestigious universities have offered 2025 places to international students that are now uncertain under new caps to be imposed by the federal government.

title.children: International student offers to some prestigious unis had already gone out before controversial caps announced

image.altText: Josh Burns in parliament

props.synopsis: The Labor backbencher has told the ABC the census was a chance to "tell people that you count and that you matter".

title.children: 'We should include the LGBTQIA+ community': Labor MP lashes his party over census

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding a takeaway coffee laughs with Kurt Campbell.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bridled at questions from journalists about a private conversation where he joked with US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell about splitting the cost of the Pacific Policing Initiative announced yesterday in Tonga.

title.children: Albanese caught on camera joking about Pacific policing plan with top US official

image.altText: Broken Tooth 2

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has endorsed a casino owner's side venture with an associate of one of the world's most notorious gangsters.

title.children: Brisbane casino owner cleared for business with associate of notorious gangster

image.altText: Man wearing military gear holds gun and stands next to armoured vehicle

props.synopsis: The IDF statement said a man called Muhhamad Jabber had been "eliminated" and that he was the head of a terrorist network.

title.children: Top Islamic Jihad commander Mohammed Jaber killed in Israeli counterterrorism operation

image.altText: A child enjoying the wet weather in Perth.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology's long-range outlook is tipping a warm spring for much of Australia, with the potential for wetter-than-normal conditions through parts of the east.

title.children: Is the unseasonal winter heatwave a sign of what's in store for spring?

image.altText: View of Brisbane river from Walter Taylor Bridge

props.synopsis: The heritage-listed bridge in Brisbane's west will close for more than two weeks in September to allow for maintenance, but the move has reignited concerns about traffic in the area.

title.children: Temporary closure of Walter Taylor Bridge reignites debate over need for duplicate river crossing

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie 2024-08-29 10:08:00

props.synopsis: Tasmanian senator Jacqui Lambie says her experiment in state politics has come to an end and apologises to Premier Jeremy Rockliff for the "instability" her party has caused.

title.children: Lambie apologises to premier for instability, says she won't run any more Tasmanian state candidates

image.altText: A middle-aged, dark-haired man in a dark suit stands outside and speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Embattled Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson failed during a fiery meeting to secure a council-funded, $175,000-per-year personal advisor.

title.children: Mayor under investigation loses bid for $175,000-a-year personal advisor

image.altText: Portrait picture of a woman with long dark hair cupping her chin in her hand.

props.synopsis: Police say the 63-year-old Queensland grandmother has no connections to NSW Mid North Coast, where her remains were found.

title.children: Missing Queensland grandmother's remains found 800km from home on NSW Mid North Coast beach

image.altText: Two men walking on a busy street with children on their shoulders.

props.synopsis: People living in Australia have better health outcomes and face less inequality compared to other high-income countries in the Anglosphere.

title.children: Australians are living longer than most people in English-speaking OCED countries, new research says

image.altText: albanese, with his partner, waves as he walks in a parade of people holding rainbow flags

props.synopsis: Labor tried to snip off a loose thread this week, left hanging from the Coalition era. Instead, it ripped a bigger hole for itself with a community it would normally hope to have onside.

title.children: When Labor saw a loose thread, it ended up ripping a hole that it's struggling to close

image.altText: Hughenden caravan park

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man has faced court charged with stealing a caravan which had a family of five still inside it.

title.children: Man arrested after theft of caravan with family inside at outback holiday park

image.altText: Lakeisha Patterson swims at the Paris Paralympics

props.synopsis: Australia's strong para-swimming squad make a statement in the opening session of heats, while the Steelers face defending champions Great Britain in their opening match of the wheelchair rugby. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie para-swimmers to chase gold after setting the pace in Paris heats

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Para-swimming: World record falls in the pool
Para-swimming: Gallagher, Crothers to chase medals in men's S10 50m freestyle

image.altText: Sumeyye Boyaci dives backwards

props.synopsis: As the Paralympic Games get underway in Paris, all eyes will be back on the pool at Paris La Défense Arena. But sometimes people have questions, like how do swimmers with no arms finish a race? Fortunately, Paralympic medallist Elizabeth Wright explains.

title.children: How do you swim straight? — and other questions Paralympic swimmers get asked

image.altText: Bridget Flack is pictured with flasses and curly hair and a small smile at the camera

props.synopsis: Coroner Ingrid Giles' investigation into the deaths of five transgender women heard gender-diverse people had "a myriad of horror stories" about their experiences of healthcare, and she's recommended urgent changes as a result.

title.children: Victorian coroner recommends more improvements in trans health care following investigation into five deaths

image.altText: CFMEU MEMBERS RALLY BRISBANE

props.synopsis: Affiliation and donations to the ALP have been suspended, administrators forced in, and now Labor is using the bad stench around the CFMEU as a political weapon against the Greens.

title.children: A Greens MP's CFMEU antics call up memories of Tony Abbott standing in front of 'Ditch the Witch' placards

image.altText: A group of young Indigenous children are playing basketball inside the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre.

props.synopsis: Children as young as 10 years-old could be sent to juvenile detention in the Northern Territory under the new government.

title.children: 'Still have their baby teeth': Leaders slam plan to jail kids

image.altText: Four young men carrying plastic bottles and bags of items wade through shoulder-deep brown water.

props.synopsis: Releasing their report just as another typhoon made landfall in Japan, researchers from World Weather Attribution said Gaemi's wind speeds were about 14kph more intense and its rainfall up to 14 per cent higher as a result of warmer sea temperatures.

title.children: Deadly Typhoon Gaemi's wind speed, rainfall were intensified by climate change, attribution study shows

image.altText: Doctor holds child in an emergency room at hospital. There are three people surrounding the man and child.

props.synopsis: Emergency physician Mohammed Mustafa has recently returned home from volunteering in two of Gaza's hospitals, and he says the situation there is a "humanitarian catastrophe".

title.children: 'I felt compelled to help': A Perth doctor's account from the hospitals of Gaza

image.altText: Aivi Luik walks in a tracksuit

props.synopsis: Matildas star Aivi Luik saw her world crash down around her after being found guilty of a doping violation before the Paris Olympics. She wants to use her experience as a warning to other athletes.

title.children: 'It made my heart drop': Matildas star warns other athletes after revealing doping ban

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: Convicted paedophile and former national rock climbing coach Stephen Mitchell loses a bid to have his child sexual abuse sentence reduced due to a judge's calculation mistake, and is sentenced to an additional 19 months for lying to get a top secret security clearance.

title.children: Stephen Mitchell, who abused six girls he coached in rock climbing, sentenced to an extra 19 months' jail

image.altText: A woman looks past the camera, smiling

props.synopsis: No criminal charges will be laid over Veronica Nelson's cruel and preventable death in a Victorian prison, after the state's workplace safety watchdog declared there was "insufficient evidence" to prosecute justice officials or a prison healthcare provider.

title.children: No charges to be laid over Veronica Nelson's 'harrowing' death in Victorian prison cell

image.altText: A bald middle-aged man looks with his brow furrowed at another man in a courtroom

props.synopsis: Robert Telles killed investigative journalist Jeff German in a stabbing that rocked Las Vegas and the United States. He will now spend at least 20 years in prison for the murder.

title.children: A reporter's stories led to the end of a politician's career. Two years later, one of them was convicted for murdering the other

image.altText: A man in an SES uniform stands with his back facing a 'road closed' sign

props.synopsis: Another truck has crashed on the Bruce Highway, 25 kilometres from Tuesday's five-truck pile-up, prompting widespread calls for urgent funding to improve safety.

title.children: Trucking companies consider avoiding night driving after two crashes on the Bruce Highway

image.altText: Richard Marles National Press Club speech

props.synopsis: The defence minister requested a second office be opened for ministerial duties, just a three-minute walk from his electorate office.

title.children: Defence Minister Richard Marles opened $600k second office despite already having one three minutes away

image.altText: Two men in Australian Paralympic singlets wince as they power along in wheelchairs, with one balancing a football on his lap.

props.synopsis: Until he was 12, Ryley Batt got around school on a skateboard because he didn't want to be seen in a wheelchair. Now he's competing at his sixth Paralympics in wheelchair rugby.

title.children: 'Bumper cars on steroids': How 'murderball' is taking Ryley to his sixth Paralympics

image.altText: Luxor Obelisk, DJ Myd and Australia's flagbearers

props.synopsis: The French colours are everywhere you look for the opening ceremony, a local DJ gets his playlist spot on, and the Australians are worth the wait when they hit the Champs-Élysées. Here are your quick hits from Paris.

title.children: Paralympic quick hits: The Games turn red white and blue, DJ Myd rules the dance floor, and Aussies make it in style
